title: Limits for sequences of extended real numbers
content: Textbooks generally use a single symbol to denote the limit of a sequence of real numbers. But then, three distinct definitions are usually given: one for the case of convergence to a real number, one for the case of limit to ` +oo ` and one for the case of limit to ` -oo `. It turns out that these three definitions can be expressed as the limit w.r.t. to the standard topology on the extended reals. In this section, a relation ` ~~>* ` is defined that captures all three definitions (and can be applied to sequences of extended reals, also), see ~ dfxlim2 .

blocks.name: clsxlim
blocks.content: Extend class notation with convergence relation for limits in the extended real numbers.
blocks.origin: const class clsxlim { ~~>* }

blocks.name: diff.clsxlim.s
diff.clsxlim.c
diff.clsxlim.w
df-xlim
blocks.content: Define the convergence relation for extended real sequences. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimrel
blocks.content: The limit on extended reals is a relation. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimres
blocks.content: A function converges iff its restriction to an upper integers set converges. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimcl
blocks.content: The limit of a sequence of extended real numbers is an extended real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: rexlimddv2
blocks.content: Restricted existential elimination rule of natural deduction. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimclim
blocks.content: Given a sequence of reals, it converges to a real number ` A ` w.r.t. the standard topology on the reals, if and only if it converges to ` A ` w.r.t. to the standard topology on the extended reals (see ~ climreeq ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimclim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
} = {
  3bitrd(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))), c1))
  a1i(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1)))
  breqi(c0, clsxlim, c1, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)))
  df-xlim()
  lmss(c0, cfv(cordt, cle), c1, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), cr, c3, c2, universe, w0)
  xrtgioo2()
  a1i(w0, wcel(cr, universe))
  reex()
  a1i(w0, wcel(cfv(cordt, cle), ctop))
  letop()
  climreeq(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))), c1, c3, c2, w0)
  eqid(cfv(clm, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))))
}

blocks.name: xlimconst
blocks.content: A constant sequence converges to its value, w.r.t. the standard topology on the extended reals. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimconst(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wfn(c0, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cxr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c3)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  sylibr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1))
  eqbrtrd(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1, cxp(c3, csn(c1)), w0)
  fconst7(s0, c0, c3, c1, cxr, w0)
  mp3an2i(w0, wbr(cxp(c3, csn(c1)), cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1), wcel(cfv(cordt, cle), cfv(ctopon, cxr)), wcel(c1, cxr), wcel(c2, cz))
  letopon()
  lmconst(cfv(cordt, cle), cxr, c1, c2, c3)
  breqi(c0, clsxlim, c1, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)))
  df-xlim()
}

  letopon()

blocks.name: climxlim
blocks.content: A converging sequence in the reals is a converging sequence in the extended reals. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm climxlim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1))
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  xlimclim(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  climrecl(hs0, c1, c3, c2, c0, w0)
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c3, c0, cr, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm climxlim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  โข (w0 โ c0[~~>*]c1)
  โฃ (w0 โ c2 โ โค)
  โฃ c3 =(โคโฅ ` c2)
  โฃ (w0 โ(c0 : c3 โ โ))
  โฃ (w0 โ c0[~~>]c1)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, c0[~~>]c1)
  xlimclim(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  climrecl(hs0, c1, c3, c2, c0, w0)
  ffvelrnda(hs0, c3, c0, cr, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: cnrefiisp
blocks.content: A non-real, complex number is an isolated point w.r.t. the union of the reals with any finite set (the extended reals is an example of such a union). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnrefiisp(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, crp, wral(s1, c0, wi(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cc), wne(cv(s1), c1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(cabs, co(cv(s1), cmin, c1)))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(c1, cr)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfn))
  -| wceq(c0, cun(cr, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  sylib(w0, wrex(s0, crp, wral(s1, c0, wi(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cc), wne(cv(s1), c1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(cabs, co(cv(s1), cmin, c1)))))), wrex(s0, crp, wral(hs0, c0, wi(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wne(cv(hs0), c1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1)))))))
  cnrefiisplem(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2, cun(csn(cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c1))), ciun(hs0, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1))))), cinf(cun(csn(cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c1))), ciun(hs1, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs1), cmin, c1))))), cxr, clt), w0)
  eqid(cun(csn(cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c1))), ciun(hs0, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1))))))
  infeq1i(cun(csn(cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c1))), ciun(hs1, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs1), cmin, c1))))), cxr, clt, cun(csn(cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c1))), ciun(hs0, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1))))))
  uneq2i(csn(cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c1))), ciun(hs1, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs1), cmin, c1)))), ciun(hs0, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1)))))
  cbviunv(hs1, hs0, cdif(cin(c2, cc), csn(c1)), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs1), cmin, c1))), csn(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c1))))

blocks.name: xlimxrre
blocks.content: If a sequence ranging over the extended reals converges w.r.t. the standard topology on the complex numbers, then there exists an upper set of the integers over which the function is real-valued (the weaker hypothesis ` F e. dom ~~> ` is probably not enough, since in principle we could have ` +oo e. CC ` and ` -oo e. CC ` ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimmnfv
blocks.content: A function converges to minus infinity if it eventually becomes (and stays) smaller than any given real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: xlimconst2
blocks.content: A sequence that eventually becomes constant, converges to its constant value (w.r.t. the standard topology on the extended reals). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

thm xlimconst2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c4)), clsxlim, c1))

  eqtrd(cfv(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c4)), cv(s0)), c1, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, c4))))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, c4)), wceq(cfv(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c4)), cv(s0)), cfv(c0, cv(s0))))
  fvres(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, c4), c0)

blocks.name: xlimpnfv
blocks.content: A function converges to plus infinity if it eventually becomes (and stays) larger than any given real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: xlimclim2
blocks.content: Given a sequence of extended reals, it converges to a real number ` A ` w.r.t. the standard topology on the reals (see ~ climreeq ), if and only if it converges to ` A ` w.r.t. to the standard topology on the extended reals. In order for the first part of the statement to even make sense, the sequence will of course eventually become (and stay) real: showing this, is the key step of the proof. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimclim2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
} = {
  impbida(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)), wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  xlimclim2lem(hs0, c0, c1, c3, c2, wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)))
  xlimxrre(hs0, c3, c0, c2, c1, wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wcel(c2, cz))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wcel(c1, cr))
  simpr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  mpbird(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)), wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  xlimclim2lem(hs0, c0, c1, c3, c2, wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  climxrre(hs0, c3, c0, c2, c1, wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wcel(c2, cz))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wcel(c1, cr))
  simpr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
}

blocks.content: A function converges to plus infinity if it eventually becomes (and stays) larger than any given real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimpnfmpt
blocks.content: A function converges to plus infinity if it eventually becomes (and stays) larger than any given real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: climxlim2
blocks.content: A sequence of extended reals, converging w.r.t. the standard topology on the complex numbers is a converging sequence w.r.t. the standard topology on the extended reals. This is non-trivial, because ` +oo ` and ` -oo ` could, in principle, be complex numbers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: dfxlim2v
blocks.content: An alternative definition for the convergence relation in the extended real numbers. This resembles what's found in most textbooks: three distinct definitions for the same symbol (limit of a sequence). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfxlim2v(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), w3o(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wceq(c1, cmnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))), wa(wceq(c1, cpnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2))))))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cxr))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

blocks.name: dfxlim2
blocks.content: An alternative definition for the convergence relation in the extended real numbers. This resembles what's found in most textbooks: three distinct definitions for the same symbol (limit of a sequence). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: climresd
blocks.content: A function restricted to upper integers converges iff the original function converges. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Apr-2023.)

blocks.name: climresdm
blocks.content: A real function converges iff its restriction to an upper integers set converges. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Apr-2023.)
